entry.title: Why Are 15-Year Mortgages so Appealing Right Now?
entry.content:
The Salt Lake real estate market is diverse with both buyers and sellers alike seeking a variety of different properties. As a prospective seller, you can find out the market value of your property with a free home value report right here, or if you're looking to purchase in the Salt Lake area click here for full MLS access. Always feel free to reach out to us for any questions regarding the current market conditions, or the value of your property at 801.285.0521

Today, I want to discuss something many homeowners and home buyers could benefit from, the 15-year mortgage. 

In any given market, there are 30-year mortgages and 15-year mortgages available for home buyers to purchase. Usually, the difference between the 30-year and 15-year mortgage is only about half a percent. Right now, we're seeing a difference of .75%! 

This doesn't sound like a lot, but if you understand the time value of money principle, this starts to look like a bigger deal. The time value of money principle is currently working for you - terms are as valuable as price, so make sure you're utilizing low interest rates if you have the ability to. 

Another thing to consider is how fantastic it would be to have your home paid off in only 15 years! This is a great way to pay more money toward your principal in a quicker amount of time and start saving for retirement sooner! 

If you want to take advantage of our fantastic market conditions, or if you have any questions about 15-year mortgages, don't hesitate to give us a call or shoot us a quick email. We would love to hear from you!

Today, we're going to share some quick information about a new loan program that we think could have a big effect on the Salt Lake City market. 

In December, Fannie Mae announced plans for a new 3% down program on conventional loans. This is huge - buyers can now get a conventional loan for cheaper than a FHA loan, which requires 3.5% down! On a $200,000 home, that's a difference of $1,000 down. While that doesn't seem like much, we've found that $1,000 can make a huge difference to buyers.

For sellers, this new program will make your home affordable to more buyers. With the spring real estate season just around the corner, this program came just in time!

If you have any questions about this new 3% down product, or if you would like real estate assistance of any kind, don't hesitate to give us a call or shoot us an email. We would love to hear from you!

entry.title: Why Did Your Home Fail to Sell?
entry.content:
The Salt Lake real estate market is diverse with both buyers and sellers alike seeking a variety of different properties. As a prospective seller, you can find out the market value of your property with a free home value report right here, or if you're looking to purchase in the Salt Lake area click here for full MLS access. Always feel free to reach out to us for any questions regarding the current market conditions, or the value of your property at 801.285.0521

Today, we discuss the four things you need to do to sell your home after the holidays. Let's get right to it! 



  1. Pack up and organize: Do you have anything in your home that's outdated or unnecessary? Get rid of it! If you have something you can take apart, make sure you're storing it somewhere it looks light, bright, and neat. People are going to be walking through your home - this is the first step to take when selling.
  2. Take a look around: Look for issues with the property. Make sure there aren't any scuff marks on the walls, food stains on the ceiling or floor, and other things that may go unnoticed until certain things are moved around. We're finding that 25% of contracts are falling through due to maintenance and repair items, so make sure to take care of those items up front so you can get maximum value.
  3. Check out the inside of your house: You may notice faulty gutters, or siding that has been damaged. Additionally, make sure your landscaping is looking good.
  4. Consult a professional: A real estate agent knows things that will help your home sell quickly and for top dollar. We have a 75-point photography checklist, an inspector that will check out the home, and a stager that will make it look nice. Just keep in mind that there are a number of things you can do to get maximum value out of your property!
Thanks for visiting the blog, we hope you find this information helpful! If you have any questions, or would like real estate assistance of any kind, don't hesitate to give us a call or shoot us an email! We would love to help make your real estate experience a special one!

entry.title: How Can You Make 2015 Your Best Year Yet?
entry.content:
The Salt Lake real estate market is diverse with both buyers and sellers alike seeking a variety of different properties. As a prospective seller, you can find out the market value of your property with a free home value report right here, or if you're looking to purchase in the Salt Lake area click here for full MLS access. Always feel free to reach out to us for any questions regarding the current market conditions, or the value of your property at 801.285.0521
 
The new year is finally in full swing, and many people have made many resolutions. There is no better time to set goals for the year, but what's the most effective way to do so? Today, we answer just that.

  • Write down all of your financial goals for 2015. Make sure they are precise and that they strike an emotional chord with you. They should be something you want to do and that you'll do anything to accomplish. "Don't just think it, ink it!" 
  • Create a budget. Fore-go some of the things you don't need - don't get as much Starbucks, or cancel the subscription to that magazine you never read, for example. Put a budget in place and follow it relentlessly.
  • Consolidate your loans. If it's possible, try to get rid of that debt completely. If not, start chipping away at those high-interest loans. 
  • Get into low interest. Interest rates are absolutely fantastic no matter where you look. If you're going to keep paying rates, you might as well try to obtain a lower one. 
  • Save for retirement. The journey is always moving forward. As soon as you have a little extra money, be sure to sweep it off the table and put it into something that generates cash flow. 
Thanks for stopping by our blog once again, we hope these tips will help make 2015 your  best year yet! If you have any questions about this topic, or would like to discuss buying or selling real estate, give us a call or shoot us an email. We would love to hear from you!

link.title: How Can You Make 2015 Your Best Year Yet?
